Package ohos.agp.render.render3d

Interface Engine


  • public interface Engine
    Provides the 3D engine.

    This interface is used to create and use the Advanced Graphic Platform (AGP) engine.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  Engine.RenderBackend
      Indicates the type of the rendering backend, which can be either OpenGL ES or VULKAN.
      static class  Engine.RenderMode
      Indicates the rendering mode.
      static interface  Engine.RenderNodeGraph
      Configures a renderer.
      static class  Engine.RenderNodeGraphType
      Indicates the type of the rendering node graph.
      static interface  Engine.Time
      Provides engine time information.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        boolean init​(Context context,
             Engine.RenderBackend backend,
             Map<String,Object> backendExtra,
             String systemGraphUri)
        Initializes the engine. You must call this method before using the engine. Extra backend mappings can be used to specify certain backend options.

        The OpenGL ES extra backend parameters are as follows:

        KeyTypeDefault value
        "MSAA_SAMPLE_COUNT"Integer0
        "DEPTH_BUFFER_BITS"Integer24
        "ALPHA_BITS"Integer0
        "STENCIL_BITS"Integer0
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the rendering context.
        backend - Indicates the backend rendering type.
        backendExtra - Indicates extra backend parameters transferred to the engine for initialization.
        systemGraphUri - Indicates the URI of the system graph file.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the engine is initialized; returns false otherwise.

      • reset

        void reset​()
        Deinitializes and then initializes the entity-component system by deleting all of the loaded entities, components, and resources.

      • release

        void release​()
        Deinitializes the initialized engine.

      • resourceCleanup

        void resourceCleanup​()
        Ensures that all GPU resources have been cleared.

        GPU resources are usually allocated and released in RenderLoop. If RenderLoop is interrupted and the engine is not released, this method can be used to process pending resource tasks if any.

      • getVersion

        String getVersion​()
        Obtains the engine version.
        Returns:
        Returns the engine version.

      • isDebugBuild

        boolean isDebugBuild​()
        Checks whether the engine is of the debugging version (debug build).
        Returns:
        Returns true if the engine is of the debugging version; returns false otherwise.

      • setDefaultTargetBuffer

        void setDefaultTargetBuffer​(TargetBuffer targetBuffer)
        Sets the default rendering buffer for the engine. This method needs to be called again if the buffer size is changed.
        Parameters:
        targetBuffer - Indicates the rendering buffer of the engine.

      • setDefaultTargetBuffers

        void setDefaultTargetBuffers​(TargetBuffer[] targetBuffers)
        Sets the default rendering buffers array for an engine.
        Parameters:
        targetBuffers - Indicates the rendering buffers array of the engine.

      • getEngineTime

        Engine.Time getEngineTime​()
        Obtains the engine time.
        Returns:
        Returns the engine time.

      • getResourceManager

        ResourceManager getResourceManager​()
        Obtains a ResourceManager instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the ResourceManager instance.

      • getScene

        Scene getScene​()
        Obtains the default scene.
        Returns:
        Returns the default scene.

      • getGltfLoader

        GltfLoader getGltfLoader​()
        Obtains a GltfLoader instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the GltfLoader instance.

      • getGltfExporter

        GltfExporter getGltfExporter​()
        Obtains a GltfExporter instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the GltfExporter instance.

      • createMeshBuilder

        MeshBuilder createMeshBuilder​(int primitiveCount)
        Creates a MeshBuilder for building a 3D mesh.
        Parameters:
        primitiveCount - Indicates the number of primitives in the mesh.
        Returns:
        Returns the created MeshBuilder.

      • createViewHolder

        ViewHolder createViewHolder​(SurfaceProvider surfaceView)
        Creates a ViewHolder using SurfaceProvider.
        Parameters:
        surfaceView - Indicates the SurfaceProvider.
        Returns:
        Returns the created ViewHolder.

      • loadRenderNodeGraph

        Engine.RenderNodeGraph loadRenderNodeGraph​(String renderNodeGraphUri)
        Loads a rendering node graph from the specified URI, which can be used to customize the rendering pipeline.
        Parameters:
        renderNodeGraphUri - Indicates the URI of the rendering node graph.
        Returns:
        Returns the loaded rendering node graph. Returns an invalid rendering node graph if the loading fails.

      • setRenderMode

        void setRenderMode​(Engine.RenderMode renderMode)
        Sets the rendering mode of an engine.
        Parameters:
        renderMode - Indicates the rendering mode of the engine.

      • update

        boolean update​()
        Updates the engine state for rendering purposes. You can also use RenderLoop for the same purpose.
        Returns:
        Returns true if rendering is required by the updated engine; returns false otherwise.

      • requestRender

        void requestRender​()
        Requests rendering on the next frame even if the engine or scene is not changed. This method is called when RenderMode#RENDER_IF_DIRTY is used.

      • renderFrame

        void renderFrame​(Engine.RenderNodeGraph renderNodeGraph)
        Performs rendering on a frame using the customized rendering node graph. If rendering is required, call Engine#update() before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        renderNodeGraph - Indicates the customized rendering node graph.

      • renderFrame

        void renderFrame​(Engine.RenderNodeGraphType renderNodeGraphType)
        Render a frame using a built-in render graph. call Engine#update() before calling this to see if rendering is actually required. Instead of calling this a RenderLoop can be used to simplify rendering.
        Parameters:
        renderNodeGraphType - render node graph to use when rendering.

      • activateContext

        void activateContext​()
        Activates the rendering context.

      • deactivateContext

        void deactivateContext​()
        Deactivates the OpenGl rendering context.

      • handleDevGuiTouchEvent

        boolean handleDevGuiTouchEvent​(TouchEvent event)
        Checks whether a touch event is processed on the GUI control of the engine.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the touch event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the touch event is processed; returns false otherwise.

      • requireRenderThread

        void requireRenderThread​()
        Checks whether the current thread is a rendering thread.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the current thread is not a rendering thread.

      • postInRenderThread

        void postInRenderThread​(Runnable task)
        Releases the task to run in a rendering thread.
        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the task to run.

      • runInRenderThread

        void runInRenderThread​(Runnable task)
        Runs a task in the rendering thread.

        If the rendering thread has already been called, the task runs immediately. Otherwise, the task is passed to the corresponding handle to run.

        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the task to run.
